intro: Aframomum kayserianum, commonly known as the African cardamom, is a perennial herb native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, branched rhizomes. The plant produces narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its rhizomes are valued for their medicinal properties and are used in traditional medicine. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
